name: whisperingly
content:
whisperingly adverb
(OF SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
with a low sound like a whisper (= a way of speaking very quietly, using the breath but not the voice): I could hear them talk whisperingly to each other in the back room. A rush of wind blew whisperingly through the trees.
More examplesFewer examplesShe whisperingly confessed to me later that she had fallen asleep during the meeting.

whisperingly adverb
(SUGGEST)
in a quiet or secret way that suggests something that may or may not be true : It has been whisperingly suggested that Mr Samuelson is going to leave his position at the end of the year. Their affair was only discussed whisperingly until the media published the text messages between the husband and his mistress.
